description: Morphology: internal word structure, inflection/derivation, and productive word-formation.

topics.name: Morphemes and Productivity
coreClaims: Morphemes are meaning-bearing units (free vs bound).
Productive processes generate new forms (compounding, affixation, conversion).
practice: Segment words into morphemes and justify boundaries.
Explain why a coinage feels 'natural' or 'awkward' (productivity constraints).

topics.name: Inflection vs Derivation
coreClaims: Inflection encodes grammatical features (tense, number) without changing lexical category.
Derivation often changes meaning and/or category (e.g., verb → noun).
practice: Classify affixes and predict category output.
